title: 2021 Supercopa Paraguay
text:
The 2021 Supercopa Paraguay was the first edition of the <a href="Supercopa%20Paraguay">Supercopa Paraguay</a>, Paraguay's <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="super%20cup">super cup</a>. It was held on 12 December 2021 between the <a href="2021%20Paraguayan%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n%20season">2021 Primera División</a> best-ranked champions in the aggregate table <a href="Cerro%20Porte%C3%B1o">Cerro Porteño</a> and the <a href="2021%20Copa%20Paraguay">2021 Copa Paraguay</a> champions <a href="Club%20Olimpia">Olimpia</a>, as the match that closed the 2021 season of <a href="Football%20in%20Paraguay">Paraguayan football</a>.
Olimpia were the winners, defeating Cerro Porteño by a 3–1 score.
Teams.
The Supercopa Paraguay is contested by two teams: the champions of the <a href="Copa%20Paraguay">Copa Paraguay</a> and the <a href="Paraguayan%20Primera%20Divisi%C3%B3n">Primera División</a> (Apertura or Clausura) champions with the best record in the aggregate table of the season.
